page.title: 04AUGHNABRACK HOUSE
page.content:
The name Aughnabrack means{WOLF HILL.} It seems that the last wolf in Ireland was shot by a farmer who lived near by.The wolf struggled down the hill where it collapsed and died and that is how Aughnabrack got its name.
Aughnabrack House is one of the biggest farms in Ballyutoag. It was built in the 18th century and the present tenents have lived there since 1920. No rebuilding has been done to the house.It has two stories and oil-fired central heating.
There are 2 workers on the farm to look after 250 head of cattle. The breeds are Charolais and Aberdeen. No crops are grown on the farm.
